Package controller

Class MainForm

java.lang.Object
controller.MainForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for the main page of the Inventory Management System created in this program.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the main page of the app populated with the data listed below. The parts table will be populated with the values set by the part commands. The products table will be populated with the values set by the product commands. RUNTIME ERROR - Not including the addPartSearchClicked method for when a user clicks on the search button leads to a runtime error, so this was added to fix that issue.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • onAddPart

      public void onAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method allows the user to add a part to the Inventory Management System app. It will create a new stage where the "Add Part Form" is.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - an action of opening a new page in the app.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getPartToModify

      public static Part getPartToModify()
      This method is utilized in other methods to indicate specific part to modify when selected by the user.
      Returns:
      Returns a part object if selected by the user.

    • onModifyPart

      public void onModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method utilizes the selected part from the user and opens the page titled "Modify Part Form".
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - the action of opening a new page for modifying a part within the app.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onPartSearchButton

      public void onPartSearchButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method will utilize the parts search field when a user clicks on the search button to find if there are any matching parts.
      Parameters:
      event - Will check the Inventory of parts against the user's input to see if there are any matches when the search button is clicked.

    • addPartSearchClicked

      public void addPartSearchClicked(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      This method will check to see if the parts search field for Parts table in the app is empty. If empty, the table will be repopulated and shown to the user of whatever the inventory is.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, resets the parts table to show all the existing parts.

    • onDeletePart

      public void onDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method allows the user to delete a selected part from the Inventory Management System app. It will remove the selected part from the Inventory class.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - an action of deleting the selected part from the Inventory.

    • onAddProduct

      public void onAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method allows the user to add a product to the Inventory Management System app. It will create a new stage where the "Add Product Form" is.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - an action of opening a new page titled "Add Product Form" in the app.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getProductToModify

      public static Product getProductToModify()
      This method is utilized in other methods to indicate specific product to modify when selected by the user.
      Returns:
      Returns a product object if selected by the user.

    • onModifyProduct

      public void onModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method utilizes the selected part from the user and opens the page titled "Modify Product Form".
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - the action of opening a new page for modifying a product within the app.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDeleteProduct

      public void onDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method allows the user to delete a selected product from the Inventory Management System app. It will remove the selected product from the Inventory class.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case - an action of deleting the selected product from the Inventory.

    • onProductSearchButton

      public void onProductSearchButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method will utilize the product search field when a user clicks on the search button to find if there are any matching products.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, it will check the Inventory of products against the user's input to see if there are any matches when the search button is clicked.

    • onAddProductSearchClicked

      public void onAddProductSearchClicked(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      This method will check to see if the products search field for Parts table in the app is empty. If empty, the table will be repopulated and shown to the user of whatever the inventory is.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, resets the products table to show all the existing parts.

    • onExit

      public void onExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method will display a notification to the user asking to confirm if they want to exit the program or not.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, the confirmation of closing the program.
